name: Nightcap: (Near the) Pearl JAM!
description:
Come on out to a late-night Improv Jam at Bexar Stage! All levels are welcome. Even if you've never done improv before, come on out and play!

This event is free if you play, or $5 if you just want to sit back and enjoy the performances. As always, you are welcome to BYOB.

name: The Sure Thing: Schizo w/Chernobyl, Stuck Here For Now
description:
On Saturday nights, Bexar Stage curates a show that we KNOW you will love. Welcome to The Sure Thing.

Schizo - One scene. 2 people. Too many characters.
(Estevan J. Chuy Zarate, Tina Jaxling)

Chernobyl Improv - When it comes to these powerhouse disasters, there is no leadership here in Chernobyl.
(J'Leen Saeger, Lisa Marley Little, Tina Jaxling, Tori Lori)

Stuck Here For Now - Disparate personalities are thrown into the same home and forced to interact with each other. Some get along, some hate each other, and some find love. Watch as people, relationships, problems, and resolutions all flicker to life -- then burst into flames!
(David Boaz, Heather Estelle Guerrero, Jessica Chavez, Lynn Thomas, Rick Copperpot, Sawyer Williams)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of a comedy class? It's a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

We are BYOB, so grab your favorite beverage and come have a few laughs!

name: Chuy Zarate Workshop: Forget What You Know
description:
FORGET WHAT YOU KNOW with Estevan J. Chuy Zarate

Feel like your scenework is stagnating? Do you find yourself resting on what you know works in front of an audience for self-gratification? Do you get too far into your head when you are trying to build a simple scene? Too many times improvisers feel the need to be clever or witty on stage.

Do you get stuck in a whirlwind of bits that really serve no purpose in a scene? It might be time to forget what you know and remember that there are simple building blocks to scene work. There is no better way to get out of your head and back into the scene than remembering the basics. We will wipe the slate clean.

To be successful at the long scene, you need to be proficient in the short scene. By the end of this workshop, you should have a strong instinct for creating quick relationships and lasting scene premises. You will look at scene starts as the most important aspect of every scene. Your relationship establishing "muscle memory" will hopefully take over and guide you to satisfying and creative scenes.

If you're still working on improv basics, stick with it!  But since this is a "BACK to basics" class, improvisers with a year or more of improv experience will be most comfortable in this class.
______________
Estevan J. Chuy Zarate is an actor/director/coach from San Antonio TX that has been improvising for audiences for 29 years. He is a member of The Big Bash at Hideout Theatre, The Known Wizards (Merlin Works faculty team), Zarzamora and more duos than he can count. He teaches all styles and formats being that he has a very eclectic tool belt to reach into. If there is a scenario to be performed in, he has probably performed it. With specialties in improv singing and grounded/character-driven scenework, Chuy has coached hundreds of kids, teens, students and adults for years to multiple successes.

name: Cheap Date: Grumpy Old Men, Kisses & Fists, Bachelors Of Science
description:
Spend Friday nights with someone you love (or like, we don't judge) at Bexar Stage variety showcase, Cheap Date!

Grumpy Old Men Improv relives the past, proving that passing your prime is only a mistake in a grocery store. 
(Brian Scribner, Dave Vann, Phil Bernhardt)

Kisses & Fists - This all-woman group is a rollercoaster of fun as they build tension and create laughter through object work and character choices.
(Channing Winchell, Cristal H, Crystal Jackson, Lindsey Nave, Lynn Thomas)

Bachelors Of Science - Remember that crazy professor you once had? And that time their friend was a guest lecturer and they explained how pocket lint held the secrets to relativity? Good news! They're back together and ready to reveal even more of life's greatest non-mysteries. 
(Clint Taylor, Matthew Hall)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of a comedy class? It's a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

We are BYOB, so grab your favorite beverage and come have a few laughs!

name: The Sure Thing: Film School Rejects w/The Bright Side, Tiny Mamá
description:
On Saturday nights, Bexar Stage curates a show that we KNOW you will love. Welcome to The Sure Thing!

Film School Rejects - The Improv Royale Champions will create a movie that has never been made, in the genre of your choosing. You'll see the behind-the-scenes action and be amazed.
(Allie Gomez, Brandon Dickerson, Brian Scribner, Frankie J. B. Rodriguez, Ignacio Valdez, Wylie Kuykendall)

The Bright Side - This duo might make you smile, even when you don't want to.
(Shane Wallace, Tina Jaxling)

Tiny Mamá - Stories within stories. Never predictable, sometimes dark, always fun!
(Channing Winchell, Clint Taylor, Fálki Heiđdóttir, Kevin McCormick, Steve Circeo)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of a comedy class? It's a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

We are BYOB, so grab your favorite beverage and come have a few laughs!

name: Cheap Date: Bachelors Of Science w/Therapy 3.0
description:
Spend Friday nights with someone you love (or like, we don't judge) at Bexar Stage variety showcase, Cheap Date!

Bachelors Of Science - Remember that crazy professor you once had? And that time their friend was a guest lecturer and they explained how parasites are really aliens from Pluto? Well, good news! They're back together and ready to dive even deeper into your favorite subjects. 
(Clint Taylor, Matthew Hall)

Therapy 3.0 - Somehow comedy emerges, even when this team focuses on the darker side of relationships.
(Fálki Heiđdóttir, Jason Christopher Trevino, Steve Circeo)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of improv training? This is a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

name: Nightcap - Brian Scribner runs The Gauntlet
description:
Come out to watch one brave improviser run The Gauntlet! Tonight's warrior is Brian Scribner. He will face many perils as he is thrown into the arena to do a series of two-person shows. 

Will he come out alive at the other end? Well, it's improv, so probably yes, but you're sure to enjoy the journey!

As always, Bexar Stage is BYOB, so pick up a six-pack, buy a ticket, have a seat in theater, and be ready to laugh!

name: The Sure Thing: Lovers & Madmen w/NOT HERE and Silent Stupidity
description:
On Saturday nights, Bexar Stage curates a show that we KNOW you will love. Welcome to The Sure Thing!

Time Out / Lovers & Madmen - Allow us two, on your imaginary forces play! In scenes improvis'ed upon the world modern in the parlance and comportment of the immortal Bard. O! The world of Shakespeare thrust within our contemporary nature doth exhibit its eternal relevance! Be we Lovers & Madmen, all!
(Lex Simpson, Tina Jaxling)

Not Here Improv - A high energy team who crack each other up and do not fear the unknown, they'll show you a knock-down, drag-out, Bexar-knuckles comedy brawl.
(Clint Taylor, Kevin McCormick, Matthew Hall, Miguel Garcia, Stephanie Delgado)

Silent Stupidity - He's like an improv ninja. Silent. Dangerous. Kind of annoying. Uninvited.
(Brian Scribner, Fred, Other Fred)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of improv training? This is a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

We are BYOB, so grab your favorite beverage and come have a few laughs!

name: Cheap Date: Instoppable/Unmovable w/How's Your Gay, WeirDass
description:
Spend Friday nights with someone you love (or like, we don't judge) at Bexar Stage's variety showcase, Cheap Date!

Instoppable/Unmovable - Two people. One situation. Lots of laughs.
(Andre Nicolas Villaplana, Jason VanSlycke)

How's Your Gay - This all-queer team, with the occasional ally, will discuss their journeys through self-discovery and then play out scenes inspired by those discussions. They'll make you laugh or go hmm. Or maybe both. 
(Channing Winchell, Frankie J. B. Rodriguez, Jason VanSlycke, Lindsey Nave, Rick Copperpot, Sawyer Williams)

WeirDass - Our current Level 5 class will present their interpretation of one of the forms they are exploring in a way that only they can.
(Alan Becker, Clint Taylor, Crystal Jackson, Jonathan Chavy Chavez, Kevin McCormick, Matthew Hall)

If you have never seen longform improv before, come see what it's all about. Interested in seeing the results of a comedy class? It's a perfect, no pressure preview. Already love longform improv? We'll see you here!

We are BYOB, so grab your favorite beverage and come have a few laughs!

description:
Come on out to Bexar Stage as we close out The Big-Little Comedy Fest with a bang! Our Standup Showcase features comedians from all over -- Dallas, San Antonio, Los Angeles, and as far away as Philadelphia and New Jersey!

• Comedian Jen Marroquin (Standup / San Antonio, TX)
• Danny Neely (Standup / Dallas, TX)
• Gina DiMaggio (Standup / Lyndhurst, NJ)
• Juan Torres (Standup / San Antonio, TX)
• Ryan Roe (Standup / Philadelphia, PA)
• Jake Yarbrough (Standup / San Antonio, TX)
• Kimberly McVicar Page (Standup / Los Angeles, CA)

The Big-Little Comedy Fest is San Antonio's first comedy fest of its kind. This 4-day event will feature 30 improv, sketch, and stand-up acts from throughout Texas and as far away as Los Angeles and New Jersey. San Antonio's Bexar Stage is proud to play host to this national comedy event.

For more about Big-Little Comedy Fest, visit biglittlecomedy.com/big-little-comedy-fest.

For more about Bexar Stage, visit bexarstage.com.

As always, Bexar Stage is BYOB.

name: Andy Crouch Workshop: Instant Protagonist
description:
INSTANT PROTAGONIST with Andy Crouch

In an improvised narrative the best gift you can give yourself is nailing down who the story is about as efficiently as possible. Over three hours of workshop, you will learn and practice no less than THIRTY instantly effective tricks for identifying and doubling down your hero. These are quick, dirty and incredibly effective. Expect to be up on your feet for most of the workshop getting lots of play time and drilling the crap out of short scenes until protagonist is just another part of your improv muscle memory. And the great side effect of this work is how useful it is to know who the scene is about in just about every other style of improv as well.

(This is an intermediate-level workshop, ideal for, but not limited to, students with a base understanding of narrative improv structure.)
______________
Andy Crouch fell in love with improv in 2001 because it was cool, scary and seemed like it might change his life forever. Nearly two decades later, he makes his living as the Education Director and Lead Facilitator at the Hideout Theatre in Austin, Texas. He gets to invent and direct new show formats every year, including Fandom: Improvised Fan Fiction, Fakespeare, and the award-winning Live Nude Improv. And because Austin is an improv melting pot, he's studied all kinds of improv from great teachers like Keith Johnstone, Mick Napier, Matt Besser, Marc Sutton, Joe Bill, Randy Dixon, Jill Bernard, etc. The scariest, coolest improv he’s doing these days is trying to Yes And his way through parenting a five-year-old daughter.

name: Level 1 Improv: Scene to Show (Mondays)
description:
Level 1: Scene to Show

Our Level 1 longform improv class starts with the improv basics - listening, agreement, scenework. After that, we'll focus on the foundation of every show, the two person scene. We will familiarize you with improv essentials, such as character development, relationships, and editing. By the end of the 8 weeks, you'll understand the structure of a show and will walk away with the foundational skills required to participate in a performance at Bexar Stage.

Class is 3 hours, 7-10pm every Monday for 8 weeks (class ends August 26), culminating in a Graduation Show August 23 or 24.

This class will be taught by Not Here Improv's Clint Taylor.

name: Level 1 Improv: Scene to Show (Sundays)
description:
Level 1: Scene to Show

Our Level 1 longform improv class starts with the improv basics - listening, agreement, scenework. After that, we'll focus on the foundation of every show, the two person scene. We will familiarize you with improv essentials, such as character development, relationships, and editing. By the end of the 8 weeks, you'll understand the structure of a show and will walk away with the foundational skills required to participate in a performance at Bexar Stage.

Class is 3 hours, 6-9pm every Sunday for 8 weeks (class ends August 25), culminating in a Graduation Show August 23 or 24.

This class will be taught by Training Center Director, Brian Scribner.
